zone.line: And what thou dost not lose, that must you lament
The gods am like I not! Too deep is it felt
To the worms like I who the dust thro digs
Whom, as he, himself in the dust nourishing, lives
Is it not dust? What this high wall
From an hundred wings me straitens;,
The frippery, which with thousand ?fashioned toy
Here shall I find what me fails?
Shall I perhaps in a thousand books read
That here & there a happiness dwells ?
As that thy brain, so mine, once confused
The light day seeks & in the twilight difficult
